by bowlingfornerds

“Peter. You with me?”

“Ya-huh.”

“Alright, care to sit up?” Tony helped heave him up and Peter blinked, slow. He yawned and felt his spine squeeze out every inch of pain it could. “I’d love to have a chat with you about your health and sleeping habits,” he said, “but there’s aliens invading, so do you mind if we do it later?”

answer:

Who doodles little hearts all over the desk with their initials inside them?

  • Tony

Who starts the tickle fights?

  • Stephen

Who falls asleep last, watching the other with a small affectionate smile?

  • Stephen

title: Nose kisses
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PHP2SJ

by Bill_Longbow

He watches the sleeping man next to him. His lover, his best friend and his home. Steve doesn’t need much light to see, the twilight in the room is enough to admire his long lashes, and the way sleep has smoothed out the traces of past worries from his brow. Tony’s face is always gorgeous, but only Steve gets to see him like this, soft and still, and he doesn’t understand how his chest can fit all the love he feels, even large as it is now.

Or

How Steve takes stock of how his life has progressed to this one perfect morning.

title: too-bright-eyes and too-dark-eye-bags
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2R11qK9

by Speeps

He’d tried to act as if nothing had changed. As if all he had to do was crank up his speakers, power up his workshop and haul his armour onto his workbench, and then everything would go back to normal. A sixteen year old with too-bright-eyes and too-dark-eye-bags would come bounding in, smile wide as he slung his backpack somewhere on the floor where he’d inevitably trip over it later on.

Clint isn’t the only father to lose his child.
